result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Compel Production of Surveillance Video

Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Wilmington J Toussaint.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests motion to suppress hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court allows Mr. Toussaint to travel to Florida to address any legal matters.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly not in court.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a jury trial.  However, court previously vacated jury trial.  Status conference remains calendared on October 4, 2022 at 1:30 PM.  Mr. Toussaint notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-3-22

Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Wilmington J Toussaint.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. Defense request case be called in the morning and advises defendant in custody in Florida. State request warrant due to no information regarding Florida in custody status. Defense request additional time to get information on Florida in custody status. Court grants defense request. Case set for status in Branch 2.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defense requests a motion hearing and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence, filed

Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint not in court, defendant in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case rescheduled off the record. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
signed, Order to allow defendant to view electronic discovery

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Wilmington J Toussaint not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint in court, appear by video with attorney Theodore OReilly, appear by video.  Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer M. Tracy   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed
Motion from Defendant, Pro Se Motion for Speedy Trail Demand.

Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Wilmington J Toussaint in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wilmington J Toussaint appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
